name: Shopp + Mad Mimi
author: Lorenzo Orlando Caum, Enzo12 LLC

sections.description:
This plugin integrates Shopp with Mad Mimi.

Currently, there is an option to “opt-in” to email marketing during the checkout. However, this option only provides the store owner with permission to send emails to the customer.

It does not automatically add the customer to any third-party email services.

With Shopp + Mad Mimi this issue is resolved. If a customer “opts-in” to email marketing during checkout, then their email, first name, and last name are sent to a specified list on Mad Mimi.

Recommendations

  • Need help with your Shopp ecommerce store? Hire a Shopp consultant today.
  • View additional WordPress plugins for Shopp by Lorenzo Orlando Caum, Enzo12 LLC
  • Follow Lorenzo on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Quora, and Github

Acknowledgements

Credit to Adam Sewell who wrote the original code that allowed data to be transferred from Shopp after checkout. This code has been extended for several other services.

Credit to Mad Mimi who created the PHP API Wrapper for the Mad Mimi API.

Recommended Links

Need a Shopp developer to help you with your Shopp? Hire a Shopp developer and consultant today.

What do you think about video tutorials for Shopp? Start learning Shopp today with video lessons and tutorials
sections.installation:
1. You’ll need an account with Mad Mimi.
  2. Ensure that your Shopp is activated and up-to-date.
  3. Download Shopp + Mad Mimi. Unzip the shopp-mad-mimi folder.
  4. Upload the shopp-mad-mimi folder to the wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  5. Activate Shopp + Mad Mimi through the Plugins menu in the WordPress admin.
  6. Go to Shopp 101 → + Mad Mimi.
  7. Enter your Email, API Key, and List Name for Mad Mimi and click Save Settings.
sections.faq:
How do I get a Mad Mimi account?

Visit madmimi.com to register for an account.

What is Shopp and how do I get it?

Shopp is an ecommerce plugin for WordPress. Learn more about Shopp.

Are there any other extensions available for Shopp?

Yes, there are different extensions available including emailing marketing, short message service (sms) notifications, forms & reporting, help desk, and more. Please visit Shopp 101.
sections.changelog:
1.3

  • Changed name of menu from + Extensions to Shopp 101
  • Verified support for WP 3.9.2
  • Verified support for Shopp 1.3.5
  • Removed links to old domain name
  • Only load CSS on WP admin screen

1.2

  • Moved to new menu

1.0.7

  • Removed social sharing
  • Verified support for Shopp 1.2.4 and 1.2.6
  • Verified support for WordPress 3.5

1.0.6

  • Fixed broken links
  • Corrected grammar errors
  • Verified support for WordPress 3.4.2
  • Added notice for Shopp 1.1.9.1 and prior (no longer supported)
  • Added links to Amazon Wishlist
  • Corrected html syntax

1.0.5

  • Fixed CSS date format
  • Corrected errors from array(&$this
  • Verified support for WordPress 3.4.1
  • Verified support through Shopp 1.2.3
  • Added support to extend plugin further
  • Removed unneeded styling in css file
  • Minor updates to admin page content and layout
  • Corrected html syntax

1.0.4

  • Removed referral links
  • Fixed a PHP Notice that was appearing in the Shopp debug log

1.0.3

  • Reduced overall size of plugin
  • New Shopp email marketing opt-in screenshot
  • New plugin interface screenshots
  • Added Other Notes
  • Removed banner ad (WordPress Plugin Guidelines) and replaced with links to http://optimizemyshopp.com
  • CSS improvements

1.0.2

  • Fixed CSS border issue.
  • Removed unneeded images.
  • Updated CSS file to prevent 404 errors.
  • Added RSS feed.
  • Corrected spelling and grammar errors.
  • Added option to donate through the Shopp Help Desk.
  • License is now GPLv2.

1.0.1

  • Improved user interface
  • Added credits
  • Added free email updates
  • Added additional resources and recommendations.
  • Added information about the author.
  • Improved code for readability.

1.0

  • First version!

short_description: Customers who opt-in to email marketing from your WordPress e-commerce site during checkout are added to a specified list on Mad Mimi.
